intro: Orthosiphon newtonii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf horsegram, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Orthosiphon newtonii is used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
